intro: Coppensia warmingii, commonly known as the Christmas Island waratah, is a striking flowering plant native to Christmas Island in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy red or pink bracts that resemble flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with thick, leathery leaves. It is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat and thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
